sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词均可表示"无知的"之意。
means: ignorant ： 指一般的无知或指不知道某个具体的事。
illiterate ： 指不识字的人或没有文化的人。

sentence.Network_en: A small but significant number of 11-year-olds are illiterate.
sentence.Network_cn: 数量不多但仍有相当一部分11岁孩子是文盲。

sentence.Network_en: There 50 percent or more of the population is illiterate.
sentence.Network_cn: 那里50%或更多的群众是文盲.

sentence.Network_en: There are still many illiterate people in our country.

jx.jx_en_mean: lacking the literacy necessary for coping with most jobs and many everyday situations

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin illitteratus, from in- 'not' + litteratus (see literate)

entry.def: Someone who is illiterate does not know how to read or write.

example.ex: A large percentage of the population is illiterate.
example.tran: 文盲人口占有相当高的比例。

entry.tran: (音乐、科技、经济上)知之甚少的,接近无知的
entry.def: If you describe someone as musically, technologically, or economically illiterate, you mean that they do not know much about music, technology, or economics.

example.ex: Many senior managers are technologically illiterate.
example.tran: 许多高级经理都对技术知之甚少。

means.word_mean: 1. not able to read or write
2. ignorant of the fundamentals of a given art or branch of knowledge;

auth_sentence.content: Three-quarters of the population of nine million were illiterate.
auth_sentence.res_content: Three-quarters of the population of nine million were illiterate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Three-quarters of the population of nine million were illiterate.

auth_sentence.content: Serious expression or musically illiterate pandering to the masses?
auth_sentence.res_content: Serious expression or musically illiterate pandering to the masses?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Serious expression or musically illiterate pandering to the masses?

auth_sentence.content: Northern children are more likely to be malnourished and illiterate.
auth_sentence.res_content: Northern children are more likely to be malnourished and illiterate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Northern children are more likely to be malnourished and illiterate.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"使……,成为,进入,再"; 2. 放在同辅音词根前表示"不,无"

stems_affixes.word_buile: illusion[[n.幻觉]]男→adj.虚幻的
il不,无+legal合法的→adj.非法的
il不,无+legible可读的→adj.难读的,难认的
il不,无+liberal宽大的→adj.气量狭窄的,吝啬的
il不,无+licit合法的, 正当的→adj.违法的,违禁的
il不,无+limit限制+able……的→adj.无限的
il不,无+literate有文化的→adj.不识字的
il不,无+logical逻辑的→adj.不合逻辑的
il使……,成为,进入,再+lus玩弄+ion表名词→被[幻觉]玩弄→幻觉
il使……,成为,进入,再+lumin光+ate表动词→使…光明→说明
il使……,成为,进入,再+lustr=lust光+ate表动词→使…光明→说明
il不+literate认字的→adj.不识字的
liter文字,字母+al……的→adj.文字[上]的;字面的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 文学上的,文学的;精通文学的,从事写作的
stems_affixes.word_buile: liter文字,字母+ary……的→adj.文学上的,文学的;精通文学的,从事写作的
liter文字,字母+ate……的→adj.有文化的
il不+literacy[n.有文化,有教养,有读写能力]→没有文化→文盲

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有文化,有教养,有读写能力
stems_affixes.word_buile: liter文字,字母+acy性质,状态→n.有文化,有教养,有读写能力
liter文字,字母+ati表复数→文字人→文人学者
obliterate[v.涂掉,擦掉]+ion表名词→n.涂去, 删除
ob倒,去掉+liter文字,字母+ate表动词→去掉文字→擦掉

sentences.en: An illiterate,later he received some schooling.
sentences.cn: 他原先大字不识一个,后来接受一些学校教育。
